These people aren't exactly 100% correct. Not all jackhammers are pneumatic (compressed air) some are hydraulic (pressurized fluid) and others are electric.  They were only explaining pneumatic jackhammers.

I live in an area where I have about 12" of hardpan about 12" down so it was a difficult MyBest.Tools and back breaking task to dig a hole to plant a tree. This thing works great, breaks up the hardpan easily and quickly. Still not easy to plant a tree but the time and effort is greatly reduced. For the money it is well worth it. The case is cheap and easily cracks but the tool is good.

“Smile turns into a frown” I felt that guy. Jack hammering seems easy but hammer 10-12 hours every day in a week and you’ll change your mind real quick. I’ve been doing it for 3 years now and I’m 22. I already have nerve damage, definitely would not recommend if you have a choice
Not to mention that they can be very heavy.  Picking it up and moving it from section to section beats you up.
